SEARCH
Package com.bookapp.service

Interface IBook

All Known Implementing Classes:
BookImpl
public interface IBook
IBook is an interface that defines methods for managing a collection of Book objects. It includes methods for adding books, retrieving books based on various criteria, and sorting books. Implementations of this interface will provide concrete behavior for these methods.

Each method may throw specific exceptions if the requested operation cannot be performed, such as when books are not found based on the search criteria.

Author:
MonigaBalasubramanian

  • Method Details

    • addBook

      void addBook(Book book)
      Adds a Book to the collection.

      This method allows a new book to be added to the internal list of books maintained by the implementation.

      Parameters:
      book - The Book object to be added to the collection.

    • getAllBooks

      List<Book> getAllBooks()
      Retrieves a list of all Book objects in the collection.

      This method returns a complete list of books, typically sorted or ordered as defined by the implementation.

      Returns:
      A list of all Book objects.

    • getBookById

      List<Book> getBookById(int bookId) throws IdNotFoundException
      Retrieves a list of Book objects that match the specified book ID.

      This method searches for books with the given ID. If no books are found with that ID, an IdNotFoundException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      bookId - The ID of the book to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of books with the specified ID.
      Throws:
      IdNotFoundException - If no books are found with the given ID.

    • getBookByTitle

      List<Book> getBookByTitle(String title) throws TitleNotFoundException
      Retrieves a list of Book objects that match the specified title.

      This method searches for books with the given title. If no books are found with that title, a TitleNotFoundException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      title - The title of the book to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of books with the specified title.
      Throws:
      TitleNotFoundException - If no books are found with the given title.

    • getBookByAuthor

      List<Book> getBookByAuthor(String author) throws AuthorNotFoundException
      Retrieves a list of Book objects that match the specified author.

      This method searches for books with the given author. If no books are found with that author, an AuthorNotFoundException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      author - The author of the book to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of books with the specified author.
      Throws:
      AuthorNotFoundException - If no books are found with the given author.

    • getBookByCategory

      List<Book> getBookByCategory(String category) throws CategoryNotFoundException
      Retrieves a list of Book objects that match the specified category.

      This method searches for books in the specified category. If no books are found in that category, a CategoryNotFoundException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      category - The category of the book to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of books in the specified category.
      Throws:
      CategoryNotFoundException - If no books are found in the given category.

    • getBookByPrice

      List<Book> getBookByPrice(double price) throws PriceNotAvailableException
      Retrieves a list of Book objects that match the specified price.

      This method searches for books with the specified price. If no books are found at that price, a PriceNotAvailableException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      price - The price of the book to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of books with the specified price.
      Throws:
      PriceNotAvailableException - If no books are found at the given price.

    • sortByAnyField

      List<Book> sortByAnyField(String field)
      Sorts the list of Book objects based on the specified field.

      This method allows the list of books to be sorted based on a specified field, such as "ID", "Title", "Author", "Category", or "Price". If an invalid field is provided, it may result in an error or default behavior as defined by the implementation.

      Parameters:
      field - The field by which to sort the books. Valid options include "ID", "Title", "Author", "Category", or "Price".
      Returns:
      A list of books sorted by the specified field.
